definition: the cap of a pen, pencil, or writing brush
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: The top of your pen is going _and will soon fall.
sentences.chinese: 你的筆帽鬆了，很快就要掉了。

sentences.english: Now we can merge the layers related to the metal part of the pencil .
sentences.chinese: 現在我們可以把鉛筆筆帽部分的相關圖層合併起來了。

sentences.english: The top of your pen is going adrift and will soon fall.
sentences.chinese: 你的筆帽鬆了，很快就要掉了。

sentences.english: Finally he slowly slid the cap on to his fountain pen and put away his manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 他終於把鋼筆慢慢地插入筆帽，藏起了自己的詩稿。

sentences.english: One day later, Liu found his cap for a pen in his drawer.
sentences.chinese: 一天後，劉在他的抽屜裏發現了一個筆帽。

definition: the spongy, white pulp inside the stem of rush plants, used as a wick for oil lamps
the cap of a pen, pencil or writing brush/the sheath of a pen (made of cloth, silk or thread)
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
